alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jefferson; Osage; Shawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 10:02PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Jefferson, Shawnee, northwestern Douglas and north central Osage Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 1002 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Auburn, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Tecumseh, Auburn, Pauline, Berryton and Grantville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 352 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 162 and 190. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas.
